result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darron A. DeBroux

records.addlTxt: Court calls 21CF250 & 22CF20 @ 03:10 PM Defendant Darron A. DeBroux not in court.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom.  Def. did call CC-JA and request to appear via telephone.  Court notes warrant is outstanding  for def and needs to be present in court. R.P. poster on 21CF250 in present in courtroom.  Bond poster makes statement. Court forfeits bonds of $3,000 and $5,000.

Court calls 21CF250 & 22CF20 @ 03:13 PM Defendant Darron A. DeBroux not in court.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court allowing def. to appear via telephone because no ride, however, def. didn't answer phone as received voicemail.  State moves to forfeit both case bonds and request warrant $10,000 cash bond for each case or Body only.  Court authorize warrant and orders $10,000 cash on each case, or Body, nationwide. Court moves to forfeit bond on each case, subject to hearing.

Court calls 21CF250 AIA & 22CF20 INIT  @02:57 PM Defendant Darron A. DeBroux in court.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom. 22CF20   Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. is not eligible for P.D. Def. is going to complete court appointed atty form. Bond continues.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:57 PM Defendant Darron A. DeBroux in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Darron A. DeBroux appeared by video means. All parties via zoom.  Court reviews history of case.  Court reviews letters in file.  Court will not address bond being return will continue to hold. Court will not address bail/bond today.  State gives history of case.  Court advise def. to contact P.D.  New file to track this case.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

1-26-22
State of WI vs. Darron A. DeBroux
CC Fred Kawalski, In person, Room 203
ADA Kelly Hays, via zoom
DAR
Def. appears via zoom from Langlade County Jail
Court calls @ 1:17  p.m.
State recites possibly charges, Poss of THC 2nd, repeater, Bail jumping, repeater, & Resisting, repeater
State gives facts for probable cause
State gives bail/bond recommendations
Def. makes statement RE: bond and questions on attorney rights
Court advised defendant of attorney rights
Court gives ruling & orders $5,000 cash with conditions No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Maintain Absolute Sobriety. No driving without a valid driver license.
Initial Appearance 2-7-22 @ 1:30 pm
Court will reserve right to be heard on bond @ later date
